summary: Water quality is stable but pH is slightly elevated for tilapia. TDS is within acceptable range.

insights.recommendation: Consider lowering pH to optimal range (6.5-7.0) for Blue Nile tilapia.
Maintain TDS levels; they are within acceptable limits for both fish and plants.
Monitor temperature; ensure it remains below 30°C to prevent stress on tilapia.

extended_notes:
Last 7 days overview:
• pH avg/min/max: 7.042 / 7.016 / 7.08 (trend: up)
• TDS avg/min/max: 311.389 / 295.1 / 347.6 ppm (trend: down)
• Temp avg/min/max: 27.267 / 24.19 / 30.06 °C (trend: up)

Actions (if needed):
• pH: keep ~6.6–7.2; calibrate probe with 7.00/4.01; adjust slowly.
• TDS: seedlings ~200–500 ppm; higher OK for mature plants; water-change to reduce.
• Temp: hold in target band for your fish/plants; heater/chiller/aeration as needed.
